means: 赫拉克利特（纪元前五世纪的希腊哲学家）

sentence.Network_en: Heraclitus You can't step in the same shit twice.
sentence.Network_cn: 你不能踩在同个大便上两次.

sentence.Network_en: Heraclitus thought, the world is an everliving fire.
sentence.Network_cn: 赫拉克利特认为, 世界是一团永恒的活火,万事万物都处于不断运动变化之中.

sentence.Network_en: Alexander and Gaius and Pompeius , what are they in comparison with Diogenes and Heraclitus and Socrates?
sentence.Network_cn: 亚历山大、盖耶斯和庞培与第欧根尼、赫拉克利特、苏格拉底比较起来是什么人 呢 ?

means.word_mean: 1. a presocratic Greek philosopher who said that fire is the origin of all things and that permanence is an illusion as all things are in perpetual flux (circa 500 BC)

auth_sentence.content: Heraclitus If you are not slic, you will be stuck.
auth_sentence.res_content: Heraclitus If you are not slic, you will be stuck.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Heraclitus If you are not slic, you will be stuck.

auth_sentence.content: Greek scholars Plutarch and Heraclitus advanced the idea that Theoclymenus's speech was a poetic description of an eclipse.
auth_sentence.res_content: Greek scholars Plutarch and Heraclitus advanced the idea that Theoclymenus's speech was a poetic description of an eclipse.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Greek scholars Plutarch and Heraclitus advanced the idea that Theoclymenus's speech was a poetic description of an eclipse.
